node.accessibility_caption: Brain tumor awareness

node.text:
🎉 happy first brain bash 🧠 yesterday was magical 🤍 

🤍 an extra special thank you to everyone that showed up and supported from afar 

🤍 and the biggest thank you to my incredibly talented mother @artyourselfstudio for being the creator behind it all, a wonder women, and my biggest cheerleader 

😘🧠 there is so much hope

[image description in alt text]

node.accessibility_caption: Brain tumor awareness
Brain tumor awareness poster
Brain tumor research fundraising

node.text:
🧠 my family and I are celebrating my one year surgi-versary by raising money for brain tumor research 🧠 🎉

Since raising $80,000 in December, we have come even farther. At $150,000, the first phase of my team’s project will be complete so that is our goal!

My wonderful mother is hosting an event tomorrow at her art studio - for out of town-ers, her art will be available online on Monday - I will definitely share the link, but if you’d like to make a monetary donation (THAT WILL BE MATCHED!!). Thank you so much for helping us reach this goal 🤍🤍🤍

you can: 
🤍 Venmo me @Christina-Naegeli-Costa 
or 
🤍 PayPal naegeli@umich.edu 

[image description in alt text]

node.accessibility_caption: Neurosurgeon surgery anniversary

node.text:
🧠 yesterday was my first surgi-versary - I saw my neurosurgeon last week so clearly I had to get an up date of our now annual selfie 🎉

a year ago my brain was open on an operating table for 13 hours while an incredibly talented team worked to remove as much tumor as they could…oh did I mention that I was awake during portions of it? 

here I am a year later

🧠 I still have a brain tumor
🧠 I still am undergoing treatment 
🧠 I still get to teach the best class ever (bias noted)
🧠 I still get to write
🧠 I still get to read
🧠 I still spend time loving my family and friends
🤍 Now I get to do them all with just a little more purpose

[image description in alt text]

node.accessibility_caption: Therapy is for everyone

node.text:
🧠 therapy is for everyone 🌍 

I procrastinated by making this graphic in canva to add to my intro psych class 

It’s a great reminder for us all that 

1️⃣ therapy is for everyone and…

2️⃣ listing campus resources in a syllabus isn’t enough. I went to a talk a couple a years ago that encouraged educators to bring up resources for students throughout the semester, and what better way to do that then when talking about therapy! 

[image description in alt text]

node.accessibility_caption: Standing in front of sunflower field holding a sign that says chemotherapy round seven

node.text:
🧠 chemo round 7️⃣

feels good to be officially past the half way mark with treatment. we visited a sunflower farm for this round and it was beautiful 🌻😍

[image description in alt text]

location.name: DeBuck's Corn Maze and Pumpkin Patch

node.accessibility_caption: I teach psychology brain

node.text:
🧠 happy first day of school 📚 

I don’t tell college students to kiss their brain…because they are like…adults…but I found these mini brain stress balls (on amazon) so I can tell them to squeeze our beautiful wonderful brains 🤗 🧠 

hope those of you who started today had a great day back! I’ve cried only maybe once or twice or three times 🥺 I am so happy to be on campus part time and doing what I love 

[image description in alt text]

node.accessibility_caption: First day of class student survey

node.text:
✏️ here are some questions that are on my survey that I have student fill out day one 📄 

can you spot the new question? ☺️ 

I will never stop talking about access needs. Important to not that I include it in my survey but also then talk about what they mean in class in case this is the first time students are hearing about them! I am also v excited at the new tik tok/meme question and am looking forward to the responses 🤣

Teacher ter celebrate neurodiversity

node.text:
✏️ new year, new teacher tees 🗓

I made these new ‘celebrate neurodiversity’ 🎉and ‘accessibility isn’t optional’ 🔑 tees with the proceeds, as always, going to brain tumor research 😘🧠

Link in bio and I will also link them in my stories. Use code B2SCHOOL for free shipping until Monday! Can’t wait to see y’all in them ☺️

[image description in alt text]

Cringe free socially distanced ice breakers for teachers

node.text:
⭐️ cringe-free, socially/distanced get-to-know-yous for the beginning of the year ⭐️ 

I recently read an article about ice breakers to brainstorm and they suggested having college students go around the room make the animal noise that goes with their name….it’s a no for me 🤣 🧊 

🧊 I usually make name tags that I keep with me throughout the semester, but will not be doing that to limit passing things around in class. I am going to make a google slides presentation instead and have students add images/text with different get to knows yous (e.g., favorite food or their dream dinner guest)

🧊 This or that - @thetownieteacher has a FANTASTIC list of questions she uses for attendance that you could use for a this or that activity - put the questions in a slide deck and have student poll in or simply show a 1 or 2

🧊 Roll the dice - Have a list of six questions on a slide - roll a virtual dice (rolladie.net) for each student and ask them to share the question that corresponds with that number (low stakes because students can see all the questions and be prepared) 

🧊 What’s in my bag - ask students to choose one item they have with them (could be from a bag, pocket, anything) and it’s significance (e.g., a receipt, a favorite pen, umbrella)

🚨 Reminder: as with all ice breakers and get-to-know-yous, I always let students know that it is ‘challenge by choice’ and students can always opt of if they don’t want to answer

[image description in alt text]

Chemotherapy six rounds holding sign with each rounds picture on it

node.text:
😘🧠 6 down, 6 to go 😘🧠

Finished my last dose of chemo for this round last night. Feels good to be over the hump. Hoping the next six rounds are as stable and as calm as the first! 🎉 

[image description in alt text]
